Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: How often does this child become angry or anxious when going from one activity to another?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=About half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always

ElementDescription: How often does this child show concern when others are hurt or unhappy?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=About half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always

ElementDescription: When excited or all wound up, how often can this child calm down quickly?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=About half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always

ElementDescription: How often does this child lost control of his or her temper when things do not go his or her way?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=About half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always

ElementDescription: Compared to other children his or her age, how much difficulty does this child have making or keeping friends?
Notes: 0=No difficulty; 1=A little difficulty; 2=A lot of difficulty

ElementDescription: Compared to other children his or her age, how often is this child able to sit still?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Sometimes; 2=About half the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=Always

How often does this child go to bed at about the same time on weeknights?

Notes: 6=Less than 7 hours; 7=7 hours; 8=8 hours; 9=9 hours; 10=10 hours; 11=11 hours; 12=12 or more hours

ElementDescription: If the child is less than 12 months old, in which position do you most often lay this baby down to sleep now?
Notes: 1=On his or her side; 2=On his or her back; 3=On his or her stomach

ElementDescription: On most weekdays, about how much time did this child spend in front of a TV, computer, cellphone, or other electronic device watching programs, playing games, accessing the internet or using social media?
Notes: 0=Less than 1 hour; 1=1 hour; 2=2 hours; 3=3 hours; 4=4 or more hours

ElementDescription: During the past week, how many days did you or other family members read to this child?
During the past week, how many days did you or other family members tell stories or sing songs to this child?
How well do you think you are handling the day-to-day demands of raising children?
Notes: 0=Not well at all; 1=Not very well; 2=Somewhat well; 3=Very well

ElementDescription: During the past month, how often have you felt: That this child is much harder to care for than most children his or her age?

During the past week, on how many days did all the family members who live in the household eat a meal together?
Does anyone living in your household use cigarettes, cigars, or pipe tobacco?
If yes, does anyone smoke inside your home?
During the past 12 months, how often were pesticides used inside your residence to control for insects?
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Once during the past 12 months; 2= Once every 6 months; 3=Once every 2-5 months; 4=Once a month; 5=Once a week; 6=More than once a week; 99=Don't know

ElementDescription: During the past 12 months, other than in a shower or bathtub, have you seen any mold, mildew or other signs of water damage on walls or other surfaces inside your home?
When your family faces problems, how often are you likely to do each of the following? Talk together about what to do
Notes: 0=None of the time; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=All of the time

ElementDescription: When your family faces problems, how often are you likely to do each of the following? Work together to solve our problems
Notes: 0=None of the time; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=All of the time

ElementDescription: When your family faces problems, how often are you likely to do each of the following? Know we have strengths to draw on
Notes: 0=None of the time; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=All of the time

ElementDescription: When your family faces problems, how often are you likely to do each of the following? Stay hopeful even in difficult times
Notes: 0=None of the time; 1=Some of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=All of the time

ElementDescription: Since this child was born, how often has it been very hard to cover the basics, like food and housing, on your family's income?

Notes: 0=Often we could not afford enough to eat; 1=Sometimes we could not afford enough to eat; 2=We could always afford enough to eat but not always the kinds of food we should eat; 3=We could always afford to eat good nutritious meals
